newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas shares end mixed, mostly off in slim trade.
newsitem.headline: Caracas shares end mixed, mostly off in slim trade.

text.p: Shares on the Caracas Stock Exchange closed mixed but mostly lower in trade termed sluggish by brokers due to the market holiday in the United States.
According to preliminary figures from the exchange, the market's 19-share .IBC index fell 0.44 percent to 6,613.39 as 13 stocks rose, 20 slipped and 13 closed flat.
"The session was very quiet with little volume due mainly to that fact that it is a holiday in the United States and there were no foreigners," said Geronimo Paolini of the Vencred brokerage.
U.S. markets were closed Monday for the Presidents' Day holiday.
Trading volumes were weak, brokers said, with 1.958 billion bolivars ($4.1 million) changing hands.
Among heavily traded stocks, market leaders telephone company CANTV and electric utility Electricidad de Caracas continued their recent strong performances.
CANTV rose 25.00 bolivars to 2,100.00 bolivars while Electricidad edged up 5.50 bolivars to 525.50 bolivars. Steel company Sivensa, meanwhile, slipped 5.95 bolivars to 319.05 bolivars.
